summary: Email chain between defense attorney Bruce Barket and an unidentified MCC official regarding an investigation into potential retaliation against Barket's client, Nicholas Tartaglione, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The emails reference a media inquiry about whether Tartaglione was questioned regarding a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, complaining about potential retaliation and false information leaks at MCC regarding his client.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Bruce Barket's client, an inmate at MCC who was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a possible attack at MCC, which prompted media inquiries.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Executive editor at The Daily Beast who emailed Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story about Tartaglione being questioned regarding Epstein.

connections.description: Barket is the defense attorney representing inmate Tartaglione.
Tartaglione was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Epstein at MCC.

events.title: Media Inquiry About Epstein Attack
events.description: Tracy Connor from The Daily Beast emails Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story that his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

events.title: MCC Official Responds to Complaint
events.description: An unidentified MCC official responds to Bruce Barket, stating the matter is under open investigation and that staff have been reminded not to retaliate against his client.

events.title: Barket Acknowledges MCC Staff
events.description: Bruce Barket sends a thank you email acknowledging that an MCC staff member (Nick) checked on his client and swapped out his books.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY
keyFacts: An NBC story reported that Nicholas Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Bruce Barket, Tartaglione's attorney, had complained to the court about potential retaliation and false information leaks regarding his client at MCC.
An MCC official confirmed an open investigation into the matter and stated staff were reminded not to retaliate against Tartaglione.
The email chain shows media attention and institutional concern regarding Epstein's safety and the treatment of other inmates at MCC in July 2019.
